cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 miles ESE of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to pass just north of Puerto Rico on Wednesday, then continue toward the Turks & Caicos/Bahamas and the Straits of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal approach just north of Puerto Rico near San Juan

weather_observation.watch_coast: Guadeloupe, Dominican Republic north coast, Haiti north coast, Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques & Culebra), U.S. & British Virgin Islands, northern Leeward Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands through Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions with sustained winds possibly 110-140 mph and gusts higher late Wednesday; tropical-storm force winds could begin Tuesday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Northern Puerto Rico coast could see water rises of 3–5 ft above normal tides with large, destructive waves
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–10 inches expected across northeast Puerto Rico with isolated 15 inches, causing flash floods and mudslides
weather_observation.other_hazards: Life-threatening surf and rip currents; significant port wave action and possible debris affecting channel navigation
